Start: ^Making note of the time, I head to Charlotte's room. I would feel bad if I was late.
^Who knows what she would think of me?

b: ^what Charlotte's room is like. I know it has to be about the same size as mine, but I can't help but picture some Victorian boudoir, decked out in antique furniture and stuff.
^if things will go differently this time. She might be the same, but I feel different.

KickedOut: ^Trissa emerges from the door ahead of me, slamming it behind her with a frustrated expression.
^[Trissa] "I don't believe it! Kicked outta my own room! That girl sometimes, I-"
^] "Actually, I was invited to tea with your roommate."
^[Trissa] "What? You mean you're the reason I've been given the boot?"
^, you are too much fun to mess with. You're gonna get us both in trouble!"
^"Good to know the reason, honestly. Not sure why she didn't just tell me she had a hot date!"
^Did she actually just wink at me there?
^] "No, it's not like that! I mean, I'm pretty sure it's not..."
^"Oh, this is you messing with me again, isn't it?"
^I can't help but smile at her playfulness.
^[Trissa] "I do kinda wish she had told me, though. She acts nice, but sometimes she can be a real ice queen. Guess that's to be expected, though, given her condition."
^"I just don't know what else I can do, ya know? I'm not hard to get along with or something, am I?"

b: ^[Voices] "Someone looking to you for validation? Now that's precious."
^I can't explain what I don't know.
^] "No, of course not. She's just jealous."
^[Trissa] "Ha! Now that's the spirit! Ball's in my court now, huh
^"I've been messin' wichu, now it's your turn?"
^] "I'm serious. She's jealous because you're nicer than she thinks she can be."
^[Trissa] "Woah, for real? Did she tell you that?"
^Trissa seems absorbed in thought, taking an uncharacteristicly long pause before speaking again.
^"You know, looking back, that does kinda make sense."
^. I feel like you lifted a veil or something."
^"I kept trying to be extra nice to her 'cause I thought that's what she wanted! Expected, even. What an idiot I've been."
^"I gotta talk to her, tell her she's the best roommate I ever had. That's the truth, by the way. By miles."
^She moves to re-enter the room, then stops herself.
^"Ah. After you guys are done chillin', of course."
^I wish I knew, honestly. I had a chance to ask her about it, but I didn't.
^I expect I'll get my chance to again.
^I decide it's best not to share what I know.

c: ^] "You're not hard to get along with at all! I don't really know why she might be like that."
^[Trissa] "Well, I guess it's not your problem, anyway. I'll figure her out eventually."
^She shakes her head and sighs, seemingly both amused and disappointed in her roommate.
^[Trissa] "I should let you get on with it, then. See you around,

g-0: ^With that, Trissa flashes a smile and strides down the hallway behind me at a modest pace.
^I tentatively rap my hand against the worn wooden door, suddenly feeling nervous.

SmallTalk: ^[Charlotte>Faint Voice] "Please enter! The door is unlocked!"
^I open the door and step inside. I am greeted by Charlotte's warm smile. At her direction, I take a seat across from her at a small table by the window.
^Looks like the tea is already prepared. Should I take a sip or not?
^If I do is there some special way I'm supposed to do it or something?
^Charlotte holds her cup gently with both hands. Her movements demonstrate a practiced ease that make me feel even more self-conscious.
^Perhaps sensing my anxiety, she breaks the silence.

b: ^"I've prepared today as a `final exam` of sorts, to see how much you've learned over the past few days."
^"Based on yesterday's progress I have high expectations!"
^[Charlotte] "And of course I should thank you for the pleasure of your company today, as well."
^[Charlotte] "I don't believe I've had the pleasure of entertaining you before. Thank you for the opportunity."

SmallTalk: ^]"Oh no, pleasure's all mine! Nothing like free food and good company... if you count tea as food, that is."
^Idiot. Now she's gonna feel bad about not having... what do people eat with tea? Scones?
^[Charlotte] "I'm sorry to say that I am fresh out of nibbles. I had to postpone my weekly trip to the store."
^] "It's no trouble! I didn't mean to sound ungrateful! This is great, really!"
^Charlotte opens a small container and withdraws a dainty spoon.
^Oh. Duh. Real quick on the draw there, me.
^] "I dunno, I don't really drink tea very often."
^[Charlotte] "Well, then I shall simply leave the sugar out. I prefer honey, myself, but consequently I am out of that as well."
^I turn my attention to the steaming cup in front of me. I raise it to my lips.
^Even before I can take a sip, my nostrils are filled with a strong, floral aroma.
^It's like no tea I've ever tasted. I don't really know how to describe tea, but I'll do my best for Charlotte's sake.
^] "This is really tasty! It kind of tastes vaguely fruity? I don't think I even need any sugar..."
^[Charlotte] "It's an Indian black tea I discovered last year: A tad more mellow than its Darjeeling cousins, without the bitter aftertaste."
^[Charlotte] "Usually I just stick to Earl Grey, but your visit presented an opportunity to bring out something special."
^Charlotte smiles and turns to face the window.
^[Charlotte] "It's such a lovely time of day, don't you think?"
^It really is nice out. I think photographers call this the `golden hour`.
^[Charlotte] "The scenery around Sunflower House is particularly idyllic in this light."
^"I try and take tea at this time every day. It relaxes me."
^[Charlotte] "Indeed. Often a lonely one, as well."
^I've never thought about before, but I guess it must be lonely for her sometimes having been here for so long. Actually, shouldn't she be getting out of here soon?
Questioning: ^"How are you finding your last week,
^Something tells me I shouldn't try to hide anything from Charlotte.
^Chances are she can probably ready everything I'm feeling without me needing to say anything. Kind spooky to think about, actually.
^But then, why ask me? Is this all a test?
^Crap, what did she just ask me? Oh, right, how my week's been.

b: ^] "It's difficult to stay positive. There's so much to do and I just feel like I'm getting nowhere."
^For a moment I can spot suprise on Charlotte's face, but she regains her composure almost immediately.
^[Charlotte] "I regret to say I make for a poor therapist, but I believe the common wisdom is that acknowledging one's problems is the first step towards solving them."
^"As such, I'm confident you will find the strength you require."
^] "It's been a long week and it's not even over."
^[Charlotte] "Ah. A sentiment with which I am intimately familiar.
^] "I keep noticing things I never noticed before. It's as though the world is brand new again. I feel like an explorer."
^For a moment I can spot suprise on Charlotte's face, but she regains her composure almost immediately.
^I feel myself start to blush and quickly hide it with a strategic sip of tea.
^"What I wouldn't give for the feeling which you describe..."
^] "I can't explain it, but there's something refreshing about this week. It feels different than all the weeks that came before."
^] "It's funny. I didn't realize what this place meant to me until I'm preparing to leave it behind."
^For a moment I can spot suprise on Charlotte's face, but she regains her composure almost immediately.
^[Charlotte] "I'm impressed by your clarity. You are quite wise for someone your age, you know."
^I feel myself start to blush and quickly hide it with a strategic sip of tea.
^"Certainly wiser than I, in any case."
^] "It's been fun, but also sad. I wish I had gotten to know everyone more before my last week!"

c: ^Hidden first week. My life has become a memorization game. I feel more like I'm studying than living.

g-0: ^[Charlotte] "And how about your mental state? How are you holding up?"

c: ^] "Kinda in the middle, honestly. Some good, some bad."

DoingFine: ^[Charlotte] "Really? You seem to be doing well enough to my eyes."
^"If your plan is to play for sympathy from a sociopath, you may wish to reconsider."
^She stifles a laugh with a carefully timed sip of tea.
InTheMiddle: ^She can probably tell I wasn't entirely honest.

DoingFine: ^[Charlotte] "With all the drama that typically befalls the residents of Sunflower House, it's nice to hear someone is still holding fast."
DoingPoorly: ^. I thank you for your honesty all the more for its bitterness."
^"I have the fullest confidence that you will triumph over the obstacles in your path."
InTheMiddle: ^[Charlotte] "A common reality and an honest answer. I appreciate your candor."
^I always liked that word, `candor`, but I never use it 'cause I'm worried people will think I'm a snob.
^Wait, but I don't think Charlotte is a snob... I bet plenty of other people do, though. She certainly does love complicated words.
FullDisclosure: ^] "Anyway, that's just in terms of my day-to-day. More than that I'm just trying to figure out what I'm supposed to do with this last week."
^"This has been my life for so many years... I don't know anything else."
^"I know when I leave everyone is gonna expect me to be `cured` or `normal` or whatever and I don't know if I can be that."
^"It really stresses me out thinking about it."
^I immediately feel guilty for having laid my burdens on Charlotte like this.
^"Sorry, you don't need to hear about any of that."
^[Charlotte] "Please, you owe no apology to anyone, least of all me."
^"Thank you for sharing this with me,
^. I know I'm far from the most sympathetic soul, but..."
^"Everyone in your life is going to give you advice. Each will be convinced they hold the secret wisdom that will turn the tides in your favor."
^"If you might pardon the irony of my saying so: Live for yourself,
^"As you can imagine, I am quite familiar with the destructive nature of selfishness. Do not confuse it with self-care."
^"I've seen the tragedy of selflessness play out, too."
^Charlotte again demonstrates her status as the most senior resident. I actually feel kinda relieved having admitted how I feel.
^I'm not sure what to make of her advice yet, though.
^In any case, having answered her questions as honestly as I could I seem to have passed her test.

Check: ^Two can play at this game. If I'm gonna prove myself to Charlotte, I have to try to read her like she can read me!
^] "Enough about me, already. How are you doing, Charlotte?"
^[Charlotte] "I am quite well, thank you for asking."
^Her answer was immediate, which means it wasn't thoughtful. She's happy that I asked, but she didn't think about her state at all.
^I'd better press her a bit more.
^] "No, really. I want to know how you've been."

b: ^[Charlotte] "You have been nothing but honest with me up to this point. I suppose it is only proper of me to extend you the same courtesy."
^"I had rather hoped to avoid burdening you with my affairs."
^Please. If anything, it'd be the other way around.
^"I do all that I can to fight my baser instincts, but no matter how long I stay here I never seem to improve."
^"I have accepted my fate. I will be the first Blackwell to return to the old Asylum."
^"Despite my fruitless years here attempting to resist, it is my just and inevitable penance."
^"I am thankful that I at least managed to help someone else to leave Sunflower House for the better."
^None of that is right! Charlotte is one of the most well-adjusted residents!
^I have to find a way to get her to understand! But how?
^] "Charlotte, none of that is true! You shouldn't give up hope!"
^. I am long past the point of grieving over my condition."
^"Nevertheless, I appreciate your concern for me."
^A flash of anger flickers on Charlotte's face, but is gone almost as soon as it arrived.
^[Charlotte] "I have nothing of note to complain about."
^Charlotte doesn't feel obliged to be honest with you, since you lied.

Understanding: ^Oh! The proof that she's wrong has been staring her in the face! Literally.
^[Charlotte] "Hmm? Oh, please do not waste your concern on me. I'm quite far gone, I'm afraid."
^] "I've been here less time than you and I can tell you I've grown a lot."
^"Even my final week has been eye-opening. You taught me all sorts of things, the other residents, too."
^"But Charlotte, you say you haven't improved in all that time."
^[Charlotte] "I must say I am not terribly impressed with your argument so far."
^Charlotte doesn't say anything, but perks up.
^"I grew because I was small and frail and you and the others gave me the sunlight and water I needed."
^"But you... you haven't grown. Not because you never will, but because you already have."
^"You've filled the soil, and now that you can't grow any more you blame yourself when you should blame the garden."
^[Charlotte] "Have you been reading the Sunflower House literature?"
^] "Well, I used to make fun of it, but now it kinda makes sense, albeit in a cringy way."
^"Look, you taught me about the nature of empathy without even having it normally or whatever! You've obviously got your shit together, pardon my language."
^"You're not going to Blackwell and you don't have anything left to gain from Sunflower House."
^Charlotte is silent for a long time.
^She turns to stare out the window, looking serenely out at the fading sunlight.
^"You think the reason I've failed to improve myself here..."
^"Is because I've been ready to leave all along?"
^] "Yeah, that's pretty much what I'm saying."
^Another long silence follows. The tension is killing me.
^[Charlotte] "This has turned out to be quite the teatime."
^"I will give some more thought to your words."
^, for your company and for your concern."
^"Now, then. It wouldn't do to keep Trissa out any longer and I should see to cleaning up."
Courtesy: ^[Charlotte] "You have learned much and performed tremendously,
^. With your natural talent, I daresay you are certain to surpass me soon enough."
^"You will try and remember me when you have conquered all the world with your charms, won't you?"
^Flatterer. I don't know if I could ever be as smooth as Charlotte, but it's nice to be complemented.

b: ^[Voices] "As if you could ever be better than anyone."

Courtesy: ^[Charlotte] "I am glad to hear that you like the tea. I was briefly worried I might have overdone it."
^[Charlotte] "I could send some with you when you depart, if you like."
^Even thinking about what I'm gonna do when I'm out of here stresses me out. Some tea might be just what the doctor ordered.
^We make small talk for another few minutes, but Charlotte carefully avoids returning to the previous subject, denying me a second chance to change her mind.
^[Charlotte] "Heavens, is that the time? I really ought to clean up and let my roommate back in."
^] "Uh-oh, did I make you late or something?"
^[Charlotte] "Oh, no, it's quite alright. If anything, this is proof of what excellent company you are."
^"However, it does also mean that our teatime has come to a close."
Ending: ^I stand up and stretch my legs.
^With that, I exit Charlotte's room out into the hallway.
